poem:
DIY SOS

A hammer's promise,  
under the Welsh sky—  
Dan's wheels seek a way,  
a home reborn from dust.  
Echoes of kindness,  
walls breathe empathy—  
volunteers' hands weave  
bricks into warmth,  
a hearth of hope.  
Nick and Gabrielle,  
pillars standing firm,  
crafting dreams beyond  
the limits of stone.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "TV tonight: Nick Knowles is back with his classic DIY show DIY SOS 8pm, BBC OneAfter first airing 26 years ago, Nick Knowles returned last week with the 34th series of his Bafta-winning home-transformation show – but there’s still a lot of heart behind the stories. This time, Nick, designer Gabrielle Blackman and their army of volunteers are helping Anna and Dan in south Wales, who need a home that supports Dan’s wheelchair and his". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
